claims.statement: Cardiolipin at OMM-IMM contact sites stabilizes VDAC in a partially closed state, altering both gating voltage-dependence and the accessibility of CBD's binding site.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It specifies a measurable gating shift of ~10-20 mV and unchanged CBD Kd in cardiolipin-free vs. cardiolipin-containing bilayers as disproof.
claims.feasible_reason: Planar bilayer electrophysiology with reconstituted VDAC and defined lipids uses standard patch-clamp setups.
claims.novel_reason: It enables testing cardiolipin-specific modulation of VDAC gating and CBD binding at OMM-IMM sites in the context of healthy vs. cancer differences.

claims.statement: Cancer cell OMM cholesterol enrichment (typically 2-4× vs normal) increases membrane partitioning of CBD, raising local membrane concentration and reducing the apparent Kd from ~11 µM (bulk) to an effective ~3-6 µM at the VDAC interface.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts a Kd reduction from ~11 µM to 3-6 µM in high-cholesterol nanodiscs, disproven by no shift in SPR or MST.
claims.feasible_reason: SPR/MST on VDAC in nanodiscs with 5% vs. 20% cholesterol is routine biophysical assay.
claims.novel_reason: It quantifies cholesterol-driven CBD partitioning specific to cancer OMM, enabling selectivity predictions.

claims.statement: Olesoxime efficacy is membrane-cholesterol-dependent because its CRAC motif mediates initial membrane anchoring; in low-cholesterol membranes (neurons under stress), olesoxime partitions less efficiently, explaining variable neuroprotective outcomes across trials.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts abolished olesoxime-VDAC interaction upon MβCD cholesterol depletion.
claims.feasible_reason: Binding assays with MβCD treatment on VDAC in liposomes or cells are standard.
claims.novel_reason: It links cholesterol dependence to variable neuroprotection, testable in the program's modulator context.

claims.statement: Liposomes engineered with cancer-mimetic lipid compositions (high cholesterol, low cardiolipin) would enhance CBD delivery to cancer OMM, potentially achieving VDAC-selective concentrations within the 1-10 µM therapeutic window while remaining below TRPV1/PPARγ activation thresholds.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts differential potency in cytotoxicity assays, disproven by no difference between cancer-mimetic and generic liposomes.
claims.feasible_reason: Liposome formulation and cell viability assays are standard in lipid delivery studies.
claims.novel_reason: It proposes composition-matched delivery for VDAC-selective CBD potency in cancer vs. normal cells.

claims.statement: Cancer mitochondria’s elevated cholesterol/phospholipid ratio increases CBD’s effective Kd by 3–5 µM due to reduced membrane partitioning.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts Kd >14 µM in cancer OMM vesicles due to high cholesterol.
claims.feasible_reason: Kd measurements in isolated OMM vesicles from cancer vs. healthy cells use ITC or SPR.
claims.novel_reason: It provides a quantitative counter-prediction to partitioning enhancement, enabling resolution of conflicting cholesterol effects.

claims.statement: Olesoxime’s neuroprotection requires >20 mol% cholesterol in OMM; below this threshold, it becomes neutral or cytotoxic.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts loss of protection at <15 mol% cholesterol in MβCD-treated neurons.
claims.feasible_reason: Dose-response in cholesterol-manipulated neurons via MβCD is feasible with viability assays.
claims.novel_reason: It sets a cholesterol threshold for olesoxime's VDAC-mediated neuroprotection.

claims.statement: Liposomes with 1:1 CL/cholesterol enhance CBD potency in cancer cells (Kd ~5 µM) but reduce it in healthy cells (Kd ~20 µM).
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts opposing Kd shifts (5 µM cancer, 20 µM healthy) with CL/cholesterol liposomes.
claims.feasible_reason: Cell-type Kd measurements with tailored liposomes use standard binding or functional assays.
claims.novel_reason: It hypothesizes cell-specific potency tuning via liposome fusion preferences.

claims.statement: Cardiolipin at OMM contact sites stabilizes VDAC in open conformation, potentially enhancing CBD binding.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts no CBD Kd shift in CL-enriched vs. PC liposomes via SPR.
claims.feasible_reason: SPR on VDAC in defined liposomes is a standard method.
claims.novel_reason: It contrasts with Claim 1 on cardiolipin stabilizing open vs. closed VDAC, enabling direct comparison.

claims.statement: Cancer OMM higher chol/PL ratio increases membrane order, reducing effective CBD concentration at VDAC due to sequestration.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts identical CBD-VDAC Kd in cancer-mimic vs. healthy-mimic liposomes by ITC.
claims.feasible_reason: ITC on liposomes mimicking lipid compositions is routine.
claims.novel_reason: It supports sequestration mechanism in cancer cholesterol effects, contrasting partitioning claims.

claims.statement: Olesoxime VDAC binding/efficacy depends on OMM cholesterol, enabling neuroprotection in chol-high healthy mitochondria.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts no potency difference in cholesterol-depleted vs. native liposomes.
claims.feasible_reason: Neuroprotection assays in cholesterol-modulated mito liposomes are feasible.
claims.novel_reason: It frames cholesterol as enabling olesoxime in healthy vs. low-chol cancer mitochondria.

claims.statement: Lipid-specific liposomes can enhance VDAC modulator potency >2x in cancer cells via chol-targeted delivery.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts no >2x potency gain in chol-mimic liposomes in cancer xenografts.
claims.feasible_reason: In vivo potency in xenografts with liposome variants uses standard tumor models, though xenograft scaling is routine.
claims.novel_reason: It quantifies liposome enhancement for VDAC modulators in cancer therapeutic window.

claims.statement: The higher cholesterol content in cancer cell OMM increases the local concentration of highly lipophilic drugs like CBD (logP 6.3), lowering the effective VDAC1-CBD Kd below the reported 11.0 uM and making VDAC a more prominent target within the therapeutic window [1.0, 10.0] uM specifically in cancer cells.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts Kd lowering in high-cholesterol proteoliposomes, disproven by no change.
claims.feasible_reason: Binding in low vs. high cholesterol proteoliposomes uses SPR or similar.
claims.novel_reason: It directly predicts cancer-specific Kd shift into therapeutic range via partitioning.

claims.statement: Olesoxime's therapeutic activity is strictly dependent on a narrow range of membrane cholesterol concentration, making it neuroprotective in healthy neurons but inert in cells with dysregulated cholesterol metabolism (e.g., certain cancers or neurodegenerative states).
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts retained activity despite artificial cholesterol depletion or overload.
claims.feasible_reason: Binding and cytoprotection in cholesterol-manipulated cells via MβCD or loading are standard.
claims.novel_reason: It defines a narrow cholesterol range for olesoxime-VDAC ternary complex efficacy.

claims.statement: Liposomes formulated with a cancer-like lipid profile (e.g., high cholesterol, low cardiolipin) will deliver VDAC modulators to cancer mitochondria more effectively than liposomes with a healthy lipid profile, increasing drug potency.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts identical IC50 for cancer-mimicking vs. healthy liposomes in cancer cells.
claims.feasible_reason: IC50 assays with lipid-variant liposomes in cell lines are straightforward.
claims.novel_reason: It tests fusion-based delivery efficiency tied to OMM mimicry.

claims.statement: Cardiolipin at OMM contact sites alters VDAC gating dynamics, likely promoting a conformation with higher affinity for certain ligands (e.g., olesoxime) but not necessarily CBD.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts identical gating in PC vs. PC+CL membranes by electrophysiology.
claims.feasible_reason: VDAC gating in defined lipid bilayers via electrophysiology is standard.
claims.novel_reason: It links cardiolipin to ligand-specific (olesoxime vs. CBD) VDAC conformations.

claims.statement: Increased OMM cholesterol in some cancers significantly raises the effective local concentration of CBD at VDAC, lowering its apparent functional Kd below the measured 11 µM.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts no Kd difference in high vs. low cholesterol nanodiscs.
claims.feasible_reason: CBD binding in cholesterol-variant nanodiscs uses routine assays.
claims.novel_reason: It quantifies local CBD enrichment in cancer OMM for VDAC targeting.

claims.statement: Olesoxime's neuroprotective effect requires an optimal, intermediate OMM cholesterol level, explaining its cell-type-specific activity.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts identical binding/protection across very high and low cholesterol.
claims.feasible_reason: Assays in cholesterol-extreme cells via manipulation are feasible.
claims.novel_reason: It explains cell-type specificity via optimal cholesterol for olesoxime recruitment and binding.

recommendation: Lab Gate PASSED. 17/17 claims cleared all three criteria. Proceeding to S4 hypothesis operationalization.
